title: Tamil Nadu CM urges Indian Govt. to secure release of fishermen held in Sri Lanka
byline: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M K Stalin on Monday urged External Affairs Minister of India S Jaishankar to initiate immediate diplomatic efforts with the Sri Lankan government to secure the release of all the arrested fishermen along with their boats.

title: Ex-Finance Ministry Secretary Charitha Ratwatte arrested by Bribery Commission
byline: A former Secretary to the Ministry of Finance Charitha Ratwatte has been taken into custody by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), this morning.

title: Three killed, four missing in Nepal avalanche
byline: An avalanche at a mountain base camp in eastern Nepal has killed at least three people and left four foreign climbers missing, a local official told AFP on Monday (Nov 3).

title: Cabinet nod given to recruit female Railway Engine Drivers and Station Masters
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval, on policy terms, to recruit female officers to the posts of Railway Engine Driver, Railway Superintendent, Station Master and Railway Supervisory Manager, in accordance with the powers vested in the Cabinet under Sub-Article (1) of Article 55 of the Constitution of Sri Lanka.

title: Individual injured in shooting near Ambalangoda UC premises
byline: An individual has been hospitalised after being injured in a shooting incident that took place this morning (04) near the Ambalangoda Urban Council premises.

title: Man injured in Ambalangoda shooting succumbs
byline: A businessman who was injured in a shooting incident in Ambalangoda earlier today (04), has succumbed to his injuries, police stated.

title: Cabinet approves ‘Road Protection Action Plan’ to reduce road accidents
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the proposal presented to implement the ‘Road Protection Action Plan - 2025-2026’, to improve the quality of road infrastructure and minimize road accidents.

title: TPA opts out of November 21 Opposition rally
byline: The Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA) has decided not to attend the rally scheduled to be held in Nugegoda on November 21 with the participation of several opposition political parties.

title: Third phase of excavation at Chemmani mass grave postponed
byline: The third phase of excavation work at the Chemmani mass grave has been postponed due to rainwater accumulating inside the burial site.

title: Apple releases iOS 26.1 update for iPhones
byline: Apple has started rolling out the iOS 26.1 update for eligible iPhone models, introducing a new Liquid Glass setting, additional language support for Apple Intelligence-powered Live Translation, and several smaller refinements.

title: Wild At Heart actress Diane Ladd dies at 89
byline: Diane Ladd, three-time Academy Award nominee and star of Wild at Heart, has died at 89.

title: ‘Wicked’ star Jonathan Bailey named ‘sexiest man alive’ by People magazine
byline: English actor Jonathan Bailey, who returns to movie theaters this month in the musical film “Wicked: For Good,” was named this year’s “sexiest man alive” by People magazine on Monday.

title: Showers expected in several areas after 2pm today
byline: Showers or thundershowers can be expected at a few places in the Sabaragamuwa, Central, Uva and Northern provinces and in the Trincomalee district after 2.00 p.m. today (04), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Sajith meets Indian FM Nirmala Sitharaman in Delhi
byline: Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa who is currently visiting India has met with Minister of Finance and Corporate Affairs Nirmala Sitharaman.

title: Kerala becomes first state in India to eradicate extreme poverty
byline: The southern Indian state of Kerala declared itself free of extreme poverty last Saturday (Nov 1), becoming the first state in the country to achieve the feat.

title: Sri Lanka reaffirms commitment to strengthen multifaceted bilateral ties with the Holy See
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath has met and held official bilateral discussions with Archbishop Paul Richard Gallagher, Secretary for Relations with States and International Organizations of the Holy See, who is on a state visit to Sri Lanka.

title: Vehicle used by Ambalangoda gunmen found
byline: The car used by the suspects in this morning’s (04) shooting in front of the main public library belonging to the Ambalangoda Urban Council has been found.

title: Maldives bans smoking for younger generations
byline: The Maldives has banned young people born on or after 1 January 2007 from smoking tobacco, becoming the only country in the world to enforce a nationwide generational tobacco prohibition.

title: Govt to procure 100 motorcycles and 50 three-wheelers for STF
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the resolution submitted to purchase 100 motorcycles with a 125cc engine capacity and 50 three-wheelers for the Special Task Force (STF).

title: Cabinet grants approval to obtain US$ 100 million for tourism sector development programme
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to obtain a loan of USD 100 million from the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to implement the Sustainable Tourism Sector Development Programme (STSDP).

title: Govt. has managed to gradually reduce budget deficit – Prof. Priyanga Dunusinghe
byline: The current government has been able to systematically reduce the budget deficit, says Professor Priyanga Dunusinghe of the Department of Economics, University of Colombo.

title: ASPI crosses 23,000 for the first time
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) surpassed the 23,000-point mark for the first time in history, during this morning’s (04) trading session.

title: Canada rejects 74% of Indian student visa applications in August, highest refusal rate globally
byline: Canada’s clampdown on international students has hit applicants from India particularly hard, government data shows, as what was once a preferred destination loses its allure for Indian students.

title: CID reports surge in complaints on scams through WhatsApp
byline: A rise in complaints concerning money being solicited through WhatsApp messages has been observed, according to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Over 1,200 arrested in “Nation United” island-wide anti-drug raids
byline: More than 1,200 individuals have been arrested yesterday (03) under the launch of the nationwide operation to eradicate drugs from the country under the theme “Nation United – National Drive”, aimed at eradicating narcotics from the country.

title: No wind power plants in Mannar without residents’ consent – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has informed authorities not to implement wind power projects without the consent of the people living in the Mannar island.

title: PM Harini meets Vatican FM Archbishop Paul Richard Gallagher
byline: Archbishop Paul Richard Gallagher, the Secretary for Relations with States and International Organizations of the Holy See has called on Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya.

title: Unions give govt. deadline to reverse school hours extension decision
byline: The Teachers’ and Principals’ Trade Union Alliance has announced that it will give the government time until November 7 to reverse the decision to extend the duration of the school term.

title: UAE’s Foreign Affairs State Minister arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: The Minister of State at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the United Arab Emirates, Saeed bin Mubarak Al Hajeri has arrived in Sri Lanka, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs said in a statement.

title: GovPay crosses Rs. 1 Billion in digital payments, onboards 200+ state institutions
byline: The Ministry of Digital Economy today announced a significant milestone in Sri Lanka’s digital transformation journey, as GovPay, the Government’s digital payment platform surpassed Rs. 1 billion in transactions and onboarded over 200 government organizations nationwide.

title: Former Fisheries Corp. chairman and 3 others arrested
byline: Former Chairman of the Ceylon Fisheries Corporation, Lalith Daulagala and three other officials have been arrested by officers of the Bribery Commission.

title: Ex-Finance Ministry Secretary Charitha Ratwatte granted bail
byline: Former Secretary to the Ministry of Finance Charitha Ratwatte has been granted bail after being produced before the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court today (04).

title: Protest over delay in releasing BYD vehicles from customs
byline: A protest was held in Colombo today (04) demanding a resolution to the delay in releasing BYD vehicles currently held by Sri Lanka Customs.

title: Vatican reaffirms support for Sri Lanka’s efforts to strengthen ethnic and religious harmony
byline: Archbishop Paul Richard Gallagher, Secretary for Relations with States and International Organisations of the Holy See, paid a courtesy call on President Anura Kumara Dissanayake this morning (04) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Dick Cheney, powerful former US vice president who pushed for Iraq war, dies at 84
byline: Dick Cheney, a driving force behind the U.S. invasion of Iraq in 2003, was considered by presidential historians as one of the most powerful vice presidents in U.S. history.

title: 31 suspects, including ex-MPs, to be indicted over attack on ‘Gota Go Gama’ protesters – AG tells court
byline: The Attorney General has informed the Supreme Court that 31 suspects have been identified in connection with the investigation into the violent attack on the “Gota Go Gama” protest site at Galle Face in May 2022 during the ‘Aragalaya’ movement and that charges would also be filed against then Senior DIG Deshabandu Tennakoon.

title: India, Sri Lanka need workable framework to address fishermen issue: Sajith Premadasa
byline: Calling the fishermen issue between India and Sri Lanka a “very important” and long-standing one, Sri Lankan Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa has said that both countries must cooperate to establish a proper, workable framework guided by international law to address the matter.
